pullRequest.body:
Compute the mgf of a gaussian.

Co-authored-by: Siyuan Ge <jamesgsy@uw.edu>

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [8185027df3](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19896/commits/8185027df39cec62491c013f8749d7ccda8ebc6a)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.Probability.Distributions.Gaussian | 2098 | 2105 | +7 (+0.33%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Probability.Distributions.Gaussian`|7|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ _root_.AEMeasurable.of_map_ne_zero`
`+ cgf_gaussianReal`
`+ mgf_add_const`
`+ mgf_const_add`
`+ mgf_dirac`
`+ mgf_gaussianReal`
`+ mgf_id_map`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
I am now computing the mgf of a general gaussian, and I added the cgf too.
I added the lemma `mgf_dirac` and removed the unnecessary assumption `hv : v \neq 0`.
@RemyDegenne , friendly ping. Thank you for your attention!
Thanks, @YaelDillies. I applied your suggestions.
Can you also add a lemma (in this PR) for the mgf of a general gaussianReal and also add cgf versions?

To have Omega be a type in any universe:
```suggestion
theorem mgf_gaussian {Ω : Type*} {m : MeasurableSpace Ω} {μ : Measure Ω}
```

We require spaces before and after `:` . Also you can remove some parentheses and use dot notation for `Measure.map`.
```suggestion
    (X : Ω → ℝ) (hXm : Measurable X) (hX : μ.map X = gaussianReal 0 1) (t : ℝ) :
```

```suggestion
  mgf X μ t = (μ.map X)[fun x => exp (t * x)] := by
```
Same suggestion everywhere else you use map.

I won't insist that you use dot notation everywhere (it's not required by the style guide), but here is an example in case you find it nicer:
```suggestion
      (measurable_exp.comp (continuous_const.mul continuous_id).measurable))
```

You can probably remove the type indication and some parentheses (untested):
```suggestion
  _ = ∫ x, exp (t * x) * gaussianPDFReal 0 1 x := by
```

```suggestion
    rw [integral_withDensity_eq_integral_smul
      (measurable_gaussianPDFReal 0 1).real_toNNReal]
```

does the following work?
```suggestion
    congr with x
```

```suggestion
  _ = exp (t ^ 2 / 2) * ∫ x, gaussianPDFReal t 1 x := by
```

You could turn that first step into a lemma:
```lean
lemma mgf_id_map (hX : AEMeasurable X μ) : mgf id (μ.map X) = mgf X μ := by
  ext x
  rw [mgf, integral_map hX]
  · rfl
  · exact (measurable_exp.comp (measurable_const_mul _)).aestronglyMeasurable
```
Almost everywhere measurability should be enough? That is, replace hXm by `AEMeasurable X μ`.
The hypothesis can then be removed entirely, since a.e.-measurability is a consequence of `hX`. Indeed `μ.map X` is defined to be zero if `X` is not a.e.-measurable.

I added a supporting lemma `aemeasurable_of_map`. It seems like it should already exist in mathlib but I could not find it. With it, I can easily remove the hypothesis `hXm`.
I put the new lemma in MeasureSpace. Do you think it belongs there?
`μ'` does not seem very useful. You should replace `(hf : μ.map f = μ') (nezero : μ' ≠ 0)` with the simpler `(hf : μ.map f ≠ 0)`.

There is a hierarchy of universes in Lean, and `Type` means a type in universe 1 (see here: https://leanprover.github.io/reference/expressions.html#universes). You should replace it with `Type*`, which means `Type u` for a newly created universe `u`: that makes the statements strictly more general with respect to universes.
Then don't use `MeasureSpace`, but use a `MeasurableSpace` and a measure. This is again for generality. A lemma written for any measure also applies to `volume` in a measure space, but the converse is not true. I know that other parts of this file use `MeasureSpace` and set a bad example, but we should fix that in another PR.
```suggestion
variable {Ω : Type*} {mΩ : MeasurableSpace Ω} {μ : ℝ} {v : ℝ≥0} {X : Ω → ℝ}
```

All those arguments are already declared in a `variable` line above. Also `X` should be implicit because it can be inferred from `hX`.
```suggestion
lemma mgf_id_map (hX : AEMeasurable X μ) : mgf id (μ.map X) = mgf X μ := by
```
Add the right version as well? The names that look most like corresponding names elsewhere in the library would be `mgf_const_add` (without the `_left`) and `mgf_add_const`.
The result is also true for `v = 0`, right? The proof will be different and probably needs one more lemma about the mgf of a Dirac.

```suggestion
theorem _root_.AEMeasurable.of_map_ne_zero {f : α → β} {μ : Measure α} (hf : μ.map f ≠ 0) :
    AEMeasurable f μ := not_imp_comm.1 map_of_not_aemeasurable hf
```

```suggestion
lemma mgf_dirac (hX : p.map X = .dirac μ) (t : ℝ) : mgf X p t = exp (μ * t) := by
```

```suggestion
theorem mgf_gaussianReal (hX : p.map X = gaussianReal μ v) (t : ℝ) :
```
Same below

```suggestion
theorem mgf_add_const (α : ℝ) : mgf (fun ω => X ω + α) μ t = mgf X μ t *  exp (t * α) := by
  simp only [add_comm, mgf_const_add]
```
to avoid swapping `X` and `α` around

Please avoid squeezing terminal simps
```suggestion
    simp [mgf_dirac hX, hv]
```

Think about writing `#min_imports` at the bottom of your file from time to time
```suggestion
import Mathlib.Analysis.SpecialFunctions.Gaussian.GaussianIntegral
import Mathlib.Probability.Moments
```

Following the line of sight rule, the main goal in your proof should stay unindented
```suggestion
  calc
  mgf X p t = (p.map X)[fun x => exp (t * x)] := by
    rw [← mgf_id_map, mgf]
    · rfl
    · apply AEMeasurable.of_map_ne_zero
      rw [hX]
      exact IsProbabilityMeasure.ne_zero (gaussianReal μ v)
  _ = ∫ x, exp (t * x) * gaussianPDFReal μ v x := by
    rw [hX, gaussianReal_of_var_ne_zero μ hv, gaussianPDF_def]
    simp only [ENNReal.ofReal]
    rw [integral_withDensity_eq_integral_smul
      (measurable_gaussianPDFReal μ v).real_toNNReal]
    congr with x
    rw [NNReal.smul_def, coe_toNNReal _ (gaussianPDFReal_nonneg μ v x), smul_eq_mul, mul_comm]
  _ = exp (μ * t + v * t ^ 2 / 2)
      * ∫ x, (√(2 * π * v))⁻¹ * exp (-(x - (μ + v * t)) ^ 2 / (2 * v)) := by
    rw [gaussianPDFReal_def, ← integral_mul_left]
    congr with x
    field_simp only [mul_left_comm, ← exp_sub, ← exp_add]
    ring_nf
  _ = exp (μ * t + v * t ^ 2 / 2) * ∫ x, gaussianPDFReal (μ + v * t) v x := by
    field_simp [gaussianPDFReal_def]
  _ = exp (μ * t + v * t ^ 2 / 2) := by
    rw [integral_gaussianPDFReal_eq_one (μ + v * t) hv, mul_one]
```

You should not be shy to chuck a bunch of stuff into a simp call
```suggestion
    simp [integral_withDensity_eq_integral_smul (measurable_gaussianPDFReal μ v).real_toNNReal, hX,
      gaussianReal_of_var_ne_zero μ hv, gaussianPDF_def, ENNReal.ofReal, NNReal.smul_def, mul_comm]
```

pullRequest.title: feat(Probability/Distributions/Gaussian): the mgf of a gaussian

I added the lemma `mgf_dirac` and removed the unnecessary assumption `hv : v \neq 0`.
@RemyDegenne , friendly ping. Thank you for your attention!
